Posts.Content: craftybiatchy wrote: Palpable mass on border of Tail of Spence and a palpable node to match. Mass is halfway between rubbery and soft, somewhat mobile, seems fixed to subcutaneous tissue but not to skin or muscle. Feels like it is wrapped around a tendon. Node is small, hard, round and fixed. The mass was visible on ultrasound two weeks ago but the node is new. Sigh. I know it has to come out. I feel it in my gut. Should I push for dissection if my GP suggests simple excision ? Oct 2012 Stereotactic Core Biopsy , Nov 2012 Lumpectomy w/ Wide Clean Margins ( yay !! ), post-op complications w/ deep tissue Hematoma & Abscess,. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Awww Crappity Crap .... craftybiatchy craftybiatchy

Posts.Content: craftybiatchy wrote: My GP sent my films, CD with mammo images, and stuff from the US down to the BC Cancer Agency in Vancouver. 3 weeks just to get an intake appointment then it could be 2 weeks or more for stereo biopsy and MRI. The provincial benchmark is 21 days from suspicious mammo to confirmed pathology. I have a BIRADS 4C lesion and I am supposed to wait nearly 2 months ? Screw public healthcare. Cashing in my RRSP's and heading down to MD Anderson or Mayo is looking pretty tempting . Oct 2012 Stereotactic Core Biopsy , Nov 2012 Lumpectomy w/ Wide Clean Margins ( yay !! ), post-op complications w/ deep tissue Hematoma & Abscess,. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 3 Effin Weeks ? craftybiatchy bevin

Posts.Content: craftybiatchy wrote: Dr. Gave me the rad report this afternoon. Not so great :( LUQ shows 3 separate regions with clustered punctate microcalcifications, & some focal density in the region. 2 clusters are outer LUQ. 1 is more centrally positioned within the LUQ. Microcalcifications are punctate and do not layer on the mediolateral view. ( What does that mean ?) Immediate referral for MRI followed by stereotactic core biopsy as these microcalcifications cannot be considered benign. I am 35, n/s, no relevant family history. No history of injury to my chest which might contribute to calcifications. No prior surgery or other invasive procedures. Ultrasound taken in the same area was negative. Can anyone translate this for me ? So I guess this means a high degree of suspicion and probable malignancy ? The report did not give a BiRad score. I am Canadian and have no clue if we even use that system here. My GP made a referral to a rapid assessment facility in Vancouver. Apparently they see you on avg 6 days after referral. Oct 2012 Stereotactic Core Biopsy , Nov 2012 Lumpectomy w/ Wide Clean Margins ( yay !! ), post-op complications w/ deep tissue Hematoma & Abscess,. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Does cannot be considered benign = malignant? craftybiatchy Lou10

Posts.Content: craftybiatchy wrote: On Friday afternoon I was sitting in my GP's exam room mentioning the weird texture of my left breast.  A 30 second, unilateral CBE and next thing I know he is filling out paperwork and making phone calls.  He didn't even bother to examine the right side (which I found odd, why wouldn't he  except if he somehow already knew that what he felt on the left could not be good).  He made it clear to his secretary not to fax it up to the hospital but that he would take it in himself.  Being a Friday |I wonder if he thought that it might sit there over the weekend and get lost in the Monday morning shuffle ?I got a call from diagnostic imaging and was told to come in tomorrow at 1:00 pm and to expect to be there for an hour at minimum. Things don't typically move this fast, do they ?   I have upper left quadrant thicking w a single axillary node and palpable mass near the end of the ''tail'' of my breast.  I have had intermittent clear/gritty/occasionally bloody nipple secretions (unilateral).  I am 35 with no risk factors other than early menarche (10 yrs old). Oct 2012 Stereotactic Core Biopsy , Nov 2012 Lumpectomy w/ Wide Clean Margins ( yay !! ), post-op complications w/ deep tissue Hematoma & Abscess,. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Dr appt Fri,in for U/S & Dx Mammo tomorrow. Moving so fast ... craftybiatchy craftybiatchy

Posts.Content: craftybiatchy wrote: Got a call from the fast track clinic in Victoria. They received my films, cd, & reports from My recent dx mammo & u/s. They want me there Monday for a repeat ultrasound, then MRI, followed by stereotactic biopsy. I don't understand why they would want a repeat u/s when the first was neg. My mammo was positive BIRADS 4C. What can they see on u/s that can't be found on mammo ?
